intro: Moquilea guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan quillwort, is a member of the plant family Characeae and is characterized by its underwater growth habit. It is a submerged aquatic plant that forms dense vegetation in freshwater environments, particularly in the lowlands of Central America. The plant has long, ribbon-like leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that are typically submerged. Moquilea guatemalensis plays an important ecological role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms. However, it is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and water pollution.
